cmdOtherOptions.message: Show KeeWeb to choose a field

errorConnectionError.message: Cannot connect to KeeWeb, please check if KeeWeb is open and browser integration is enabled in settings

errorBrowserTabNoPermissions.message: Permission to access $1 was not granted

errorBrowserCannotConnectToTab.message: Cannot connect to KeeWeb, refreshing a tab with KeeWeb may help

errorRequestTimeout.message: KeeWeb didn't respond to our request in time

optionsIntro.message: This is a browser extension for KeeWeb, a free cross-platform manager compatible with KeePass.

optionsConnectionModeApp.message: Using the native app. This is the most convenient mode of integration: KeeWeb runs in background, the extension connects to the app to fetch credentials. If you don't have the app installed

optionsConnectionModeWeb.message: Web-only: you need to have a tab with KeeWeb open, the extension connects to this tab. It's less convenient, however you don't have to install a desktop app

optionsWebConnectionTabPermission.message: To connect to the keeweb tab, we need a special permission, otherwise it won't be possible to communicate with this tab. Click this button to grant this permission to the extension

optionsWebConnectionKeeWebUrl.message: KeeWeb URL (change it if you're using your own self-hosted version)

optionsWebConnectionKeeWebUrlNotHttps.message: The URL must start with https://

optionsShortcutsDescription.message: You can change shortcuts in the extension shortcuts settings.

optionsAboutLicense.message: This extension is licensed under MIT. It includes these awesome libraries
